page.title: 03Family Life in Darwen
page.content: This survey has been taken from a small section of the community in Darwen.The average family consists of 2 to 3 children with an age gap of about 2 years.The main forms of family recreation include watching T.V.and day outings to the countryside. There is little movement of families between towns,the majority having lived here for twenty plus years.This must be due to close proximity of relatives together with their long term attachment to the area.Those that have recently moved here have taken advantage of the cheaper housing & education in schools.The majority of couples both work & are mainly employed in local industry.The more qualified jobs are filled by families recently moved to the area.The families surveyed thought Darwen was a good place to bring up a family.
